oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mother-of-pearl memorial trinket, referring to freeing of slaves
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This trinket is inscribed with the following: First page on front reads "April 19, Monday, May the words of my mouth and the meditation of my heart be acceptable in thy sight." Reverse of page says "I agree what my friend wrote in this little book some months ago." Thursday's script reads: "The Civil War was over this weekend, they tell me." Friday's script reads "The slaves were set free today poor souls." Saturday's script reads "Several slaves left today but only a few." Author is unknown.
